Article Title: Cristiano Ronaldo: Euro 2024: Concerns raised over player safety after Cristiano Ronaldo confronted by fans seeking selfies
Article Text:
Pitch invader with Portugal's Cristiano Ronaldo before being detained by stewards. (Reuters Photo)

Steward catches a pitch invader that ran to Portugal's Cristiano Ronaldo. (AP Photo)

NEW DELHI: Cristiano Ronaldo faced on-field confrontations from four supporters seeking selfies during Portugal 's 3-0 win over Turkey in Dortmund's Westfalenstadion on Saturday, leading coach Roberto Martinez to express concerns over player safety.The incidents began in the 69th minute when a young fan evaded stewards, reaching Ronaldo, who posed for a selfie. The situation escalated when, in the final minutes, two more people attempted similar actions.Following the final whistle, another person managed to get close to the 39-year-old striker for a photograph. Security intervened as two additional people tried to confront Ronaldo as he walked off the field with his teammates.WATCH:“It is a concern,” Martinez was quoted as saying by AP after the game, “because today we were lucky that the intentions of the fans were good.”“We all love a fan that recognizes the big stars and the big icons in their minds. We all agree with that. But you can understand it was a very, very difficult moment — if those intentions are wrong, the players are exposed and we need to be careful with that. I don't think that should happen on a football pitch.”Martinez emphasized the importance of communicating to fans that such behavior is not acceptable.“It's not the right way, you’re not going to get anything out of it,” Martinez added. “And what you do is probably the measures get worse for the future.“It’s not good to get the players so exposed when you have people running on the pitch.”Ronaldo's teammate, Bernardo Silva , who also scored against Turkey, shared a different perspective on the matter.“It's just a bit annoying in terms of having to stop the game because a fan enters the pitch,” Silva said. “That’s the price you pay for being so recognized in the world of football.“In terms of feeling in danger, no. Not me personally.”The series of breaches highlighted vulnerabilities in stadium security and the need for stricter measures to protect players during games.
Article Summary: Cristiano Ronaldo faced on-field confrontations from four supporters seeking selfies during Portugal's 3-0 win over Turkey in Dortmund's Westfalenstadion on Saturday. The incidents began in the 69th minute when a young fan evaded stewards, reaching Ronaldo, who posed for a selfie.

Article Title: Copa America: Venezuela defeat 10-man Ecuador 2-1 in a thrilling encounter
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Venezuela defeated Ecuador 2-1 in a thrilling Copa America match on Saturday, coming from behind with two goals in the second half. Ecuador played most of the game with 10 men after their captain, Enner Valencia , was sent off in the 22nd minute for a high boot challenge.Jeremy Sarmiento scored for Ecuador just before halftime, but Venezuelan substitutes Jhonder Cadiz and Eduard Bello each netted in the second half to secure the victory.The match took a decisive turn early when Enner Valencia made contact with Jose Martinez's face, earning a yellow card that was later upgraded to a red after a video review. This left Ecuador one man down for the majority of the game.Despite being short-handed, Ecuador managed to take the lead in the 45th minute when Jeremy Sarmiento smashed home a goal. Their advantage, however, was short-lived as Venezuela's substitutes made an immediate impact in the second half.Jhonder Cadiz leveled the match in the 64th minute. Cadiz found the net with a composed finish, capitalizing on Salomon Rondon's cushioned layoff following a quickly taken throw-in.Eduard Bello then sealed the win for Venezuela in the 74th minute. Bello scored by smashing a rebound high into the net from close range. This came after Rondon's diving header was saved by Ecuador goalkeeper Alexander Dominguez.“We fought until the end, even though we were without an important player very early. It hurts to lose... (but) we have to keep going because there are two games to go. We have a lot of character to turn this around and we are going to fight until the end,” Ecuador midfielder Moises Caicedo was quoted as saying by Reuters after the game.
Article Summary: Venezuela defeated Ecuador 2-1 in a thrilling Copa America match on Saturday. Ecuador played most of the game with 10 men after their captain, Enner Valencia, was sent off in the 22nd minute. Jeremy Sarmiento scored for Ecuador just before halftime, but Venezuelan substitutes Jhonder Cadiz and Eduard Bello each netted in the second half.

Article Title: Euro 2024: Belgium secure 2-0 victory over Romania in Group E clash
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Belgium secured a 2-0 victory over Romania in a thrilling Euro 2024 Group E match on Saturday, thanks to goals from Youri Tielemans and Kevin De Bruyne . The win resulted in all four teams in the group—Belgium, Romania, Slovakia , and Ukraine—being level on three points after two rounds. This unprecedented situation sets the stage for a decisive final round.The match took place in Cologne, in an electric atmosphere, with fans on the edge of their seats throughout. Belgium's Tielemans scored just 73 seconds into the game, setting the tone for an attacking performance. Late in the game, De Bruyne added a second goal, which could prove crucial in determining group standings."We were very relieved we won the game, it was very important to get three points," Belgium coach Domenico Tedesco was quoted as saying by Reuters after the game.Ukraine defeated Slovakia 2-1 on Friday, leaving all group teams with three points each. The final matches of the group stage will see Belgium face Ukraine and Slovakia take on Romania.A team could advance or be eliminated with just four points, with goal difference potentially playing a key role. Romania and Belgium currently hold a slight edge with a plus-one goal difference, Slovakia sits at zero, while Ukraine is at minus two.Belgium, ranked third in the world by FIFA, appeared transformed from their sluggish opening game defeat to Slovakia. From the match's beginning, Belgium displayed energy and intent. Romelu Lukaku played a key role, assisting Tielemans, who executed a precise low shot to open the scoring.Romania almost equalized four minutes later with a header by Radu Dragusin, but Koen Casteels made an excellent save. Belgium dominated the first half, with several chances from Dodi Lukebakio, Amadou Onana, and De Bruyne, whose performances continually tested Romania's defense.The Romanian fans were unwavering in their support, creating an incredible atmosphere despite Belgium’s relentless attacks. Jeremy Doku's cross nearly connected with Lukaku, and De Bruyne even had another shot narrowly miss the goalpost.Lukaku seemed to have doubled Belgium's lead an hour into the match, but VAR disallowed it for offside. This was the second time in the tournament Lukaku had goals ruled out by VAR, following a similar instance against Slovakia.The end-to-end match saw another twist as Romania's Dennis Man went clean through, only to shoot directly at Casteels. Belgium’s second goal came in an unexpected manner. Goalkeeper Casteels launched a goal kick that bypassed everyone, allowing the quick-thinking De Bruyne to score, sealing the win.The victory keeps Belgium's hopes alive for advancing beyond the group stage. Romania, despite the loss, remains in contention to reach the knockout rounds for only the second time in their history. Romania has not qualified for the last six World Cups since their golden era in the 1990s.
Article Summary: Belgium defeated Romania 2-0 in Euro 2024 Group E match on Saturday. Goals from Youri Tielemans and Kevin De Bruyne secured the win. All four teams in the group are level on three points after two rounds. Romania and Belgium hold a slight edge with a plus-one goal difference.

Article Title: Euro 2024: Patrik Schick's goal secures 1-1 draw for Czech Republic against Georgia
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Patrik Schick 's chest-fired goal secured a 1-1 draw for the Czech Republic against Georgia in an engaging Euro 2024 Group F match on Saturday.Both teams find themselves in a challenging position, each with a point, awaiting the outcome of the Portugal-Turkey game. Georgia struck first with Georges Mikautadze's penalty, but Schick equalized in a match filled with action and drama in Hamburg.Georgia, debutants in the competition, showcased their progress under coach Willy Sagnol , who highlighted his players' disappointment at their opening defeat as a sign of their growth. The Georgian team put in a spirited performance to earn their first Euros point, guided by goalkeeper Giorgi Mamardashvili's exceptional saves.Sagnol said his players' disappointment at their opening defeat showed how far his team has come, and they gave everything in Hamburg to earn their first Euros point.Mamardashvili played a pivotal role, making crucial saves early on, denying efforts from Adam Hlozek and Schick. Georgia's offensive efforts were rewarded just before halftime when Mikautadze converted a penalty, secured after a VAR review flagged a handball by Czech defender Robin Hranac.The game's momentum swung back in favor of the Czechs in the second half. Schick, who had already demonstrated his scoring prowess at Euro 2020, equalized with an improvised finish, chesting home a rebound off the post from Ondrej Lingr's header. This goal marked Schick as the Czech Republic's top scorer in Euros history, surpassing Milan Baros with six goals, but a calf injury forced him to leave the pitch midway through the second half.The Czech team, led by coach Ivan Hasek, had started strong, creating numerous chances. They were initially frustrated when VAR disallowed Hlozek's goal due to a handball, following a save by Mamardashvili that deflected back onto Hlozek’s face and arm. Czech right-back Vladimir Coufal received a booking for a foul on Georgia's standout player Khvicha Kvaratskhelia, who along with Mikautadze, had required medical attention before the match but both started.“He attempted to counter and was met with Coufal's challenge, resulting in a yellow card for the Czech defender,” observed reviewers of the game.Georgia also saw their penalty appeals for an incident involving Zuriko Davitashvili and Ladislav Krejci dismissed. Despite these setbacks, Georgia captained by Guram Kashia, managed to test the Czech defense, with Stanec making a brilliant first-half stoppage-time save before conceding the penalty kick.Czech fans experienced further tension as Krejci came close to scoring from another header, narrowly missing the target. The Czechs’ persistence nearly paid off, but they failed to capitalize on several opportunities.In an end-to-end encounter, Georgia showed impressive resolve. “Georgia's fans were in the majority…they began to roar every time Napoli winger Kvaratskhelia got the ball in opposition territory,” noted observers.The match concluded with a dramatic moment when Georgia had a golden opportunity to clinch victory. Substitute Saba Lobjanidze found himself in a prime position but fired over the bar amid a three-on-one break, leaving the match tied.This draw leaves both teams with a challenging road ahead in Euro 2024 Group F. With strong performances from both sides, they will be looking to build on this match in their subsequent fixtures. As the group progresses, the outcome of the upcoming Portugal-Turkey game may further shape their paths.
Article Summary: Patrik Schick's chest-fired goal secured a 1-1 draw for the Czech Republic against Georgia in an engaging Euro 2024 Group F match. Georgia struck first with Georges Mikautadze's penalty, but Schick equalized in a match filled with action and drama in Hamburg.

Article Title: Sinner beats Hurkacz to win first title on grass at Halle Open
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Jannik Sinner , the Italian tennis sensation ranked world number one, clinched his maiden grasscourt title on Sunday by defeating his doubles partner Hubert Hurkacz in a closely contested Halle Open final. The scoreline read 7-6(8), 7-6(2) in favor of the 22-year-old Australian Open champion.This victory marks a significant milestone for Sinner, as it is his 14th singles career title, Reuters reported.Throughout the match, both players showcased their serving prowess, saving break points and exchanging aces, which led to a tiebreak in the first set. Sinner emerged victorious in the tiebreak, gaining the upper hand.In the second set, Sinner had an opportunity to take a 2-0 lead, but Hurkacz, hailing from Poland, fought back and saved two break points.The set remained on serve, leading to another tiebreak. Once again, Sinner displayed his mental fortitude and claimed the title after winning the second tiebreak decisively."It's inspiring what you've been doing the last 12 months," Hurkacz told Sinner. "Jannik becoming number one in the world is really special. I try to learn from that. Big congrats."Sinner extended his congratulations to Hurkacz, the tournament's fifth seed, for securing a spot in yet another final. The Polish player had previously emerged victorious at the Halle Open in 2022."We're very good friends off court ... seeing us play the final here is very special. Thank you so much," he said.Sinner is preparing for Wimbledon , where he reached the semi-finals last year. The major tournament starts on July 1.
Article Summary: Italian tennis sensation Jannik Sinner wins maiden grasscourt title. Sinner defeated his doubles partner Hubert Hurkacz in a closely contested Halle Open final. The 22-year-old Australian Open champion is ranked world number one.

Article Title: Putintseva beats Tomljanovic in Birmingham tennis final
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Kazakhstan's Yulia Putintseva secured her maiden grass-court singles championship at the senior level by triumphing over Ajla Tomljanovic of Australia in the final of the Birmingham WTA Tour tournament on Sunday. The scoreline read 6-1, 7-6 (10/8) in favor of Putintseva.The 29-year-old had previously captured two WTA tour titles, both on clay surfaces. She emerged victorious in Nurnberg in 2019 and Budapest in 2021.In the final of this preparatory event for Wimbledon , Putintseva showcased her resilience by overcoming a 5-3 deficit in the second set. She saved two set points during the nearly 90-minute encounter before clinching the title.With this victory, Putintseva became only the second unseeded player to claim the Birmingham title in the past decade, following in the footsteps of Beatriz Haddad Maia, who achieved the feat in 2022."I don't know what I'm feeling because I wasn't expecting this at all," Putintseva, as quoted by AFP, said afterwards."It's great and it's confusing because I've always been good on clay, but now all of a sudden, I'm good on grass. I'll take that! It's great!"It was a great game. I started so well, and then Ajla dialled up her level to the highest. She was playing really amazing, not giving me any time to think or to do something. The game was even in the end, and I was a bit more lucky."Tomljanovic's appearance in the singles final marked a significant milestone, as it was her first at the tour level since 2018. Despite falling short of claiming the championship, the Australian player remains determined to secure her maiden title.The past week's performance served as a source of encouragement for Tomljanovic, who has faced a challenging year. The former world No. 32 was sidelined for a considerable portion of 2023 due to a knee injury that required surgical intervention. Additionally, she underwent a procedure to address ovarian cysts, further extending her time away from the court.
Article Summary: Yulia Putintseva beats Ajla Tomljanovic 6-1, 7-6 (10/8) in final of Birmingham WTA Tour tournament. Kazakhstan's 29-year-old had previously captured two WTA tour titles, both on clay surfaces. She became only the second unseeded player to claim Birmingham title in the past decade.
